answerText: Le Chatelier's principle[10] When applying Le Chatelier's principle to precipitates, this value is often useful. This value is equal to the product of the concentration of the ions comprising the precipitate.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 3 | 5 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In the hemoglobin molecule, this principle is used to explain the Haldane effect, and this principle is the reason that the Fischer esterification is done under reflux. For 10 points each: [10] Name this chemical principle, which states that a system will work to oppose any stress or change applied to it.
